javadoc.text: * Exception to be thrown when a symmetric, definite positive{@link RealLinearOperator} is expected. * Since the coefficients of the matrix are not accessible, the most * general definition is used to check that {@code A} is not positive * definite, i.e. there exists {@code x} such that {@code x' A x <= 0}. * In the terminology of this exception, {@code A} is the "offending" * linear operator and {@code x} the "offending" vector.
* Creates a new instance of this class.
